content: 8 inch tail and thread through the remaining stitches and k1 ssk 1 0 0 0 1 1 2 2 4 k2tog knit to weave in the end end you should have 35 35 37 39 40 41 42 44 48 sts on your needle place a locking second foot section stitch marker in one of the decreased stitches you using smaller needles transfer held stitches to count and measure from later needles knit across stitches until the last 2 sts place bor marker k2 pick up 3 3 4 4 5 5 6 continue knitting in the round for 2 2 8 3 2 6 8 sts from the others you cast on 3 2 4 4 4 5 5 5 5 past the last decrease round you will now work the second foot as you did the first use the row number notes to ensure that stop and count your row from the last decrease they are made the same round and make a note here _______ once the second foot is complete weave in all ***do three things in this next round*** ends 1 - remove the bor stitch marker knit 2 sts and using another length of yarn and mattress stitch place new bor marker sew the opening together to close off the slipper the locking stitch marker you left in the cast on 2 - knit the rest of the round either decreasing or edge is where to begin your mattress stitch increasing the appropriate number of stitches to get to a multiple of 4 +1 +1 -1 +1 0 -1 -2 repeat to make a second slipper 0 0 you should have 36 36 36 40 40 40 40 44 48 sts on the needles wash in hot water do not leave check often as to not over felt and have your lovely slippers be too 3 place a marker every 9 9 9 10 10 10 10 small turn smaller foot inside the bigger one and 11 12 sts you should have 4 sections let dry you can stuff with plastic grocery bags to help hold the shape toe decreases change to dpns when you can no longer enjoy your lovely new slippers comfortably fit the stitches on your needle round 1 *knit until 3 sts before 1st marker ssk k1 sm k1 k2tog knit to next marker sm* repeat one more time 4 sts decreased 2 leah barczykowski pygmy tiger knits
